page.title: 14RECREATION IN MID DEVON
page.content: There is not a lot of social life especially for young people who must go to Okehampton for cinema or to Hatherleigh for the occasional dance or meeting of the Young Farmers' Club. There is no pub or other meeting place except for social gatherings "at home". With no public transport available a car is essential and adolescents must learn to drive as soon as possible or continue to rely on parents for transport. Women's Institutes have meetings in nearly every village and are well attended mostly by the middle-aged. Members go to Folly Gate for their meetings. Social events are organised to which husbands and friends are invited. W.I's have brought about changes in rural areas and the local one is pressing for restrictions on low-flying aircraft.
